text: Even if the couple gets back together, the divorce is always part of their history.

text: Moreover, unlike the death of a loved one, who may become a fond memory, divorce seems to become unimpeachable memory that continues to generate pain forever; Eva would never forget Jack Herrick, and most memories of him were unpleasant.

text: What is there to think about.
Name: Book 27

text: One thing is if I go to work for the company, they can fire me at any time, Henry says.
Name: Book 27

text: Government wont do that.
Name: Book 27

text: What the hell does Henry know.
Name: Book 27

text: Hes probably jealous and wants it himself.
Name: Book 27

text: Big thing is, though, I dont want to be a welder.
Name: Book 27

text: He watched her closely for reaction, which came as a dark look in her eyes.
Name: Book 27

text: In a low, menacing voice, she said, Why, for Gods sake.
Name: Book 27

text: What is wrong about being a welder.
Name: Book 27

text: They always have jobs.
Name: Book 27

text: Jack, we are in a depression.
Name: Book 27

text: We are so damned lucky that youre working because most men are not working.
Name: Book 27

text: Ive seen them downtown milling about, haunted by fear of starving to death and watching their families do the same.
Name: Book 27

text: Here you are, offered a gold mine, your own private gold mine.
Name: Book 27

text: Jack.
Name: Book 27

text: I dont want to be a welder.
Name: Book 27

text: Ive watched those guys welding the tracks together, covered from head to toe in heavy, dark clothes, sweating like pigs and almost dying from the heat.
Name: Book 27

text: I could not take that.
Name: Book 27

text: So what do you want to do.
Name: Book 27

text: You tell me thats killing you.
Name: Book 27

text: Go back to Chicago and be a bouncer again.
Name: Book 27

text: She leaned back, folded her arms, and glared at him.
Name: Book 27

text: I want to work for the railroad.
Name: Book 27

text: Its the only thing I want to do.
Name: Book 27

text: Aw, poor baby.
Name: Book 27

text: Go to work for the railroad, honey.
Name: Book 27

text: Hey, thats no way to treat me.
Name: Book 27

text: Im not some little kid trying to get his way.
Name: Book 27

text: You asked me what I wanted to do, and I told you.
Name: Book 27

text: So go get a job on the railroad, for cryin out loud.
Name: Book 27

text: She got up and flung her napkin on her plate.
Name: Book 27

text: Stormys been with the L&N for twenty years, and hes on the extra board.
Name: Book 27

text: Eva rubbed her forehead and paced the kitchen.
Name: Book 27

text: Jack lit a cigarette.
Name: Book 27

text: Ciggy.
Name: Book 27

text: No Without looking up, Eva said, If you were drowning, Jack, I think youd take hold of anything that would save you.
Name: Book 27

text: Im a great swimmer, Kiddo.
Name: Book 27

text: She pushed her chair hard under the table.
Name: Book 27

text: Shit, she screamed and slammed the chair again.
Name: Book 27

text: Youre a goddamned child.
Name: Book 27

text: She stormed off to the bedroom, and soon Jack heard the bedsprings squeak and he thought he heard her crying.
Name: Book 27

text: He found her lying on her stomach and placed his hand on her shoulder.
Name: Book 27

text: You want a welder, you got one.
Name: Book 27

text: Without moving, she said, Do what you want.
Name: Book 27

text: Just get me a ticket to Denver as soon as possible.
Name: Book 27

text: Her voice was cold.
Name: Book 27

text: Stunned for a moment because hed forgotten their conversation at the hospital, he felt she had stabbed him.
Name: Book 27

text: Giving her shoulder a tender squeeze, he whispered, Okay, Kiddo.
Name: Book 27

text: Ill do it first thing in the morning.
Name: Book 27

text: Well, Im here at last.
Name: Book 27

text: The train got to St.
Name: Book 27

text: Louis just fine, and the layover there was not bad.
Name: Book 27

text: We could get off if we wanted to and go in the station, but I was tired and just stayed put and napped.
Name: Book 27

text: A nice elderly man sat in the seat next to me.
Name: Book 27

text: He told me he lived in Topeka and had been in Louisville to visit his daughter.
Name: Book 27

text: He said she lived on Spring St.
Name: Book 27

text: Do you know where that is.
Name: Book 27

text: I asked him what he did in Topeka, and he said he worked for the railroad.
Name: Book 27

text: Of course, I thought of you.
Name: Book 27

text: I told him I was going to Denver to see Mom.
Name: Book 27

text: When we got to Topeka dust was flying everywhere.
Name: Book 27

text: It made everything look gray and dead.
Name: Book 27

text: My seatmate said it was dust blown in from the west, and that wed probably run into a duster before we got to Denver.
Name: Book 27

text: I asked him what a duster was, and he said it was a dust storm so thick you couldnt see through it.
Name: Book 27

text: Well, he was right.
Name: Book 27

text: It got darker and darker as we left Topeka and went west, and by the time we got to Salina it was pitch black and it was only five oclock in the evening.
Name: Book 27

text: Now, I mean pitch black.
Name: Book 27

text: Go in the closet, close the door, and shut your eyes real tight.
Name: Book 27

text: It was darker than that.
Name: Book 27

text: The lights came on in the car, and we could see dust floating around inside like a mist.
Name: Book 27

text: It was an icky yellowish gray and it clung to your clothes and skin, and it sifted into your eyes.
Name: Book 27

text: The conductor passed out handkerchiefs and said to tie them around our nose and mouth until we got through the storm.
Name: Book 27

text: I asked how long that would be and he said it was hard telling.
Name: Book 27

text: The rails were covering up and the train had to move slowly to plow through the drifts across the tracks.

frame.Frame: Cause change of position on a scale

Name: Book 27

text: He said it could take a couple of days, and it did.
Name: Book 27

text: Jack, just imagine the thickest cloud you can think of.
Name: Book 27

text: Then imagine its on the ground.
Name: Book 27

text: Now pretend it is as black as coal.
Name: Book 27

text: Thats what we traveled through for two days.
Name: Book 27

text: The wind was the worst.
Name: Book 27

text: It howled and screamed and rocked the cars.
Name: Book 27

text: We thought wed go over a few times, especially if we had to stop for some reason, which we did a lot.
Name: Book 27

text: The car rattled in the wind, and it never let up.
Name: Book 27

text: It blew that way for two days.
Name: Book 27

text: Kids were crying, women were crying, and the men looked so scared they couldnt sit still.
Name: Book 27

text: Every time the poor conductor came in, he was mobbed with questions.
Name: Book 27

text: He was a colored man and he was so patient and kind.
Name: Book 27

text: Well, it finally stopped right before we got to Hays, Kansas, but from there to almost Denver the air was dark and dingy, and the dust in the car was all over us.
Name: Book 27

text: Ive never felt so dirty in my life.
Name: Book 27

text: I took a bath first thing when I got to Moms house, and the water was like mud.
Name: Book 27

text: I felt like getting out of the tub and washing it and then getting back in and taking another bath.
Name: Book 27

text: When we got to Denver it was beautiful.
Name: Book 27

text: The sun was shining and the sky was so blue and clear it almost hurt to look at it.
Name: Book 27

text: The air was clean, and it wasnt that horrible heat and humidity we had in Louisville.
Name: Book 27

text: It was cool with a breeze and the first night it got so cool we had to have blankets.
Name: Book 27

text: My stepfather said that was Denver.
Name: Book 27

text: It is always that way.
Name: Book 27

text: Ill not go into how I found the folks.
Name: Book 27

text: Just let me say that I am so sorry we quarreled before I left.
Name: Book 27

text: While I was riding on the train before all the dust I realized how selfish I was.
Name: Book 27

text: I imagined someone forcing me to do something I didnt want to do and I got ashamed that I got so mad at you.
Name: Book 27

text: All I was thinking about was more money and Im really ashamed of that.
Name: Book 27

text: Can you forgive me.
Name: Book 27

text: I still think this separation is good at least for me.
Name: Book 27

text: I think its good for you too because youve got to decide how youre going to accomplish your goal of working for the railroad.
Name: Book 27

text: Please take this time to do that.
Name: Book 27

text: I love you but I need this time.
Name: Book 27

text: I feel freer here than I have ever before in my life.
Name: Book 27

text: I love it here and I think I might find me here.
Name: Book 27

text: I truly think well be together again before long.
Name: Book 27

text: Please take care of yourself and be careful at work.
Name: Book 27

text: You only have nine toes left and youre not a cat.
Name: Book 27

text: Ha.
Name: Book 27

text: Ill close for now.
Name: Book 27

text: Ill write again in a day or two.
Name: Book 27

text: Maybe by then Ill have a job.
Name: Book 27

text: Ill pray for you.
Name: Book 27

text: Love always, Eva.
Name: Book 27

text: Received your letter and was very glad to hear you got to Denver safe.
Name: Book 27

text: Sorry you had to go though the dust storm.
Name: Book 27

text: Ive been listening to the radio more these days and the news is full of stories about the dust bowl.
Name: Book 27

text: Thats what they call it now.
Name: Book 27

text: Heck of a thing to have in a bowl.
Name: Book 27

text: Ha.
Name: Book 27

text: The pain in my foot is gone and Ive got used to my toe being numb.
Name: Book 27

text: I dont even think about it any more.
Name: Book 27

text: Henry, my boss, says Im still a nut but hes glad Im okay.
Name: Book 27

text: That guy from the company came back and I told him I didnt want to be a welder.
Name: Book 27

text: He said I was stupid for saying no, and when I tried to explain, he just cut me off and walked away.
Name: Book 27

text: I sure hope I did the right thing.
Name: Book 27

text: I made up my mind to do something and I hope its all right with you.
Name: Book 27

text: I got hold of my sister Mary in Texas.
Name: Book 27

text: She and her husband Fred live in Port Arthur, right where Texas and Louisiana come together on the Gulf.
Name: Book 27

text: He has a small shrimp boat and said he could use some help.
Name: Book 27

text: So I thought Id go down and see about it.
Name: Book 27

text: Fred said there was lots of shrimp but its not selling for very much but you can always eat shrimp.
Name: Book 27

text: You know I like shrimp.
Name: Book 27

text: Mary is a nurse and is still working and they dont have kids.
Name: Book 27

text: They said theyre doing good.
Name: Book 27

text: Truth is, kiddo, I need to get out of Louisville.
Name: Book 27

text: There are too many memories good and bad.
Name: Book 27

text: The good memories are of you and me, but the bad ones go way back before we met.
Name: Book 27

text: Every time I leave home I run into something that causes me to remember something.
Name: Book 27

text: At the apartment I remember you and me and how happy we were before everything happened.
Name: Book 27

text: Now it is all mixed up because youre not there.
Name: Book 27

text: I miss you so much.
Name: Book 27

text: Everywhere in the apartment I look, I see you and I got to tell you I have cried a lot.
Name: Book 27

text: When your train pulled out of the station I sat in the car and bawled like a baby for I dont know how long.
Name: Book 27

text: I hope we can get back together, kiddo, because I dont know if I can go on if we dont.
Name: Book 27

text: I love you so much.
Name: Book 27

text: And I have been good.
Name: Book 27

text: Go to work, come home, heat up a can of soup, listen to the radio awhile, and go to bed.
Name: Book 27

text: I really miss you.
Name: Book 27

text: Getting back to Texas and all, Im going down at the end of next week.
Name: Book 27

text: I gave Henry notice and all he said was he knew I was crazy now instead of just thinking it.
Name: Book 27

text: He might be right, but I got to get out of here.
Name: Book 27

text: I hope youre not mad at me for this but I think I can make some money in Texas and maybe when youre ready to get back together I can have some saved.
Name: Book 27

text: Mary said I could stay with them and Fred said I will live on the boat most of the time anyway.
Name: Book 27

text: Write me soon and let me know how you feel about this.
Name: Book 27

text: Ill write you when I get to Texas and give you there address.
Name: Book 27

text: I think they might have a phone so maybe I can call you if you give me a number.
Name: Book 27

text: Well, Ill close for now.
Name: Book 27

text: Its late here and still hot as hell but I got to get some sleep.
Name: Book 27

text: I love you with all my heart.
Name: Book 27

text: Let me know how things are there.
Name: Book 27

text: Love forever, Jack ~~~~~.
Name: Book 27

text: Well, youre in Texas.
Name: Book 27

text: I got to say I was surprised when I got your letter and you told me why you want to go there.
Name: Book 27

text: Maybe I should say I was shocked.
Name: Book 27

text: But then I got to thinking about what I said when I told you I understood that you didnt want to be a welder but wanted to be a railroad man.
Name: Book 27

text: I guess that meant I wouldnt stand in your way whatever you chose to do.
Name: Book 27

text: Well, thats not the railroad but if it makes you happy, I guess its alright with me.
Name: Book 27

text: By the way, I got a job, too.
Name: Book 27

text: Ill tell you about it later.
Name: Book 27

text: I want to concentrate on what youre doing right now.
Name: Book 27

text: I think it is good that youre seeing your sister.
Name: Book 27

text: You have three sisters, dont you.
Name: Book 27

text: I know you talked about them but said you had no desire to see them.
Name: Book 27

text: Remember I said that wasnt natural.
Name: Book 27

text: Everybody wants to see family.
Name: Book 27

text: Im glad youre with Mary and I hope you get in touch with your other sisters too.
Name: Book 27

text: I sure would like to meet them.
Name: Book 27

text: As for me it has been a trial.
Name: Book 27

text: First Mom has been feeling badly since I got here.
Name: Book 27

text: The doctor thinks its female trouble and shell have to have an operation sooner or later.
Name: Book 27

text: Mom is none too keen on that idea and I dont blame her but if its got to be what can you do.
Name: Book 27

text: Mom has also developed what she calls nervous spells.
Name: Book 27

text: She gets real shaky all over and sees these bright lights and sweats and has to go to bed and falls asleep sometimes for two or three hours.
Name: Book 27

text: When she wakes up shes okay but hungry for sweet stuff.
Name: Book 27

text: Its really strange and her doctor doesnt seem to know what it is.
Name: Book 27

text: He thinks it might be related to her high blood pressure.
Name: Book 27

text: Dad Schlyker is fine I guess.
Name: Book 27

text: I dont see him much because hes working on some dam in the mountains with the WPA.
Name: Book 27

text: Hes gone all week except Sunday when he manages to come home for a few hours.
Name: Book 27

text: I guess the dam is not too far away.
Name: Book 27

text: My brother Woody has quit school and is training to be a welder.
Name: Book 27

text: You can get up off the floor now.
Name: Book 27

text: Ha.
Name: Book 27

text: He works for a factory here in town called Winter-Weiss and theyre training him.
Name: Book 27

text: He says he likes it alright, but I dont know.
Name: Book 27

text: Mom let him quit school because she said he wouldnt go anyway because he was ashamed of how he had to dress.
Name: Book 27

text: Lots of his clothes were hand-me-downs from his brother Sam, who has moved away, and Woody was ashamed to wear them.
Name: Book 27

text: I can understand how he feels because kids can be cruel and tease and make fun but Mom and Dad have had a rough time since leaving East Chicago when he was laid off and I think Woody should consider that.
Name: Book 27

text: Hes a solemn boy.
Name: Book 27

text: He doesnt talk much and he doesnt seem to have many friends.
Name: Book 27

text: Hes a good-looking kid with a thick head of black hair and dark eyes and a really muscular frame.
Name: Book 27

text: He asks about you all the time, but hes just too quiet.
Name: Book 27

text: Hes smoking now and I think he might be drinking some because there are times he seems a little tipsy when we talk and at that time he talks a lot like something has loosened his tongue.
Name: Book 27

text: He seems different then, too, argues more and gets mad easy.
Name: Book 27

text: I worry but cant do anything.
Name: Book 27

text: Moms too sick to do anything and Dads off working.
Name: Book 27

text: Now Maddy is fifteen and she is going to be a real beauty.
Name: Book 27

text: She has thick, thick auburn red hair, big brown eyes and a figure that wont quit.
Name: Book 27

text: Im actually more worried about her than I am Woody because right now shes hard for Mom to handle.
Name: Book 27

text: She sasses Mom, cusses at her, and you know how Mom reacts to that.
Name: Book 27

text: When Maddy is home all you hear is screaming and crying from Maddy or Mom.
Name: Book 27

text: I just dont know what will happen.
Name: Book 27

text: She wont listen to me.
Name: Book 27

text: That sisterly relationship we had is gone and shes quick to tell me to keep out of it and shut up.
Name: Book 27

text: I think she is smoking too because she has yellow stains on the first two fingers of her left hand just like you and I do.
Name: Book 27

text: Sam like I said has moved out.
Name: Book 27

text: Hes somewhere in the mountains working in a mine.
Name: Book 27

text: Mom is worried to death because she knows hes still drinking a lot and hes working at the most dangerous job in the mine as a steel driver and blaster.
Name: Book 27

text: Mom says he drills the holes and sets the dynamite to blow up the wall of coal.
Name: Book 27

text: She worries hell go to work drunk sometime and kill himself and a bunch of other men.
Name: Book 27

text: I have to agree it is a worry.
Name: Book 27

text: But their little house is so darling, Jack.
Name: Book 27

text: Its small with two bedrooms that run off this huge living room that goes straight into the kitchen and off onto a back porch.
Name: Book 27

text: Its like you would take a shoebox and divide it into three rooms and a bath off the kitchen.
Name: Book 27

text: The bath is small but sufficient.
Name: Book 27

text: The kitchen is small also but it has two big pantries built into the walls.
Name: Book 27

text: One is in the corner between the living room and stove and the other is in the west wall before you go onto the back porch.
Name: Book 27

text: Its a brick house and they have it painted white.
Name: Book 27

text: Theres a huge window in the front of the living room looking out east.
Name: Book 27

text: Its not a very pretty view because there is a vacant lot across the street that is not kept cut down very well and the street is not paved which allows dust to come into the house.
Name: Book 27

text: It drives Mom crazy.
Name: Book 27

text: Off the back porch you can look west across the mountains and that is a beautiful sight.
Name: Book 27

text: Dad showed me how you can see Ruby Hill where the city dump is and on across to the high mountains.
Name: Book 27

text: He says in the winter if you look real close you can see Mt.
Name: Book 27

text: Holy Cross that has a canyon that fills with snow and looks like a cross.
Name: Book 27

text: I havent seen it of course because its summer.
Name: Book 27

text: On the north side of the property is a great big place owned by Mexicans.
Name: Book 27

text: Moms not very pleased with that, as she does not like Mexicans at all.
Name: Book 27

text: But she says its better than having Negroes over there.
Name: Book 27

text: Of course she did not call them Negroes either, just like you do.
Name: Book 27

text: On the south side are two houses, one right after another.
Name: Book 27

text: Their back yard is great big and Dad says hes going to raise chickens and rabbits.
Name: Book 27

text: The front yard is small with a huge old locust tree that gives a lot of shade.
Name: Book 27

text: On the north between their house and the Mexicans is a large area they use for a garden.
Name: Book 27

text: Dads a great gardener.
Name: Book 27

text: He plants all kind of vegetables and has a very good patch of strawberries started.
Name: Book 27

text: Of course Mom has planted thousands of flowers and the place looks real pretty.
Name: Book 27

text: Dad says hell build a garage one day if he ever gets a car.
Name: Book 27

text: Dad says hes going to dig a basement under the house when he gets a chance probably next summer.
Name: Book 27

text: He wants to put a coal furnace down there because right now the only heat is a wood stove in the living room.
Name: Book 27

text: But Mom says with the wood cook stove in the kitchen that the house will be real warm in the winter.
Name: Book 27

text: Maddys room is right off the living room where it comes to the kitchen.
Name: Book 27

text: Woody sleeps on the porch that Dad says hes going to enclose.
Name: Book 27

text: Mom sleeps in the front bedroom as does Dad when hes home.
Name: Book 27

text: Ive been sleeping on the couch and it is not too much fun doing that.
Name: Book 27

text: Mom still expects me to do most of the housework and cooking, which is all right since they arent charging me rent, but sharing a bathroom with Maddy is a major pain in the you know what.
Name: Book 27

text: So, Im looking for a room downtown.
Name: Book 27

text: I can eat at the restaurant where I work and if I can find a place close enough I can walk.
Name: Book 27

text: Right now I have to catch the number 3 streetcar over on Broadway about a block away across that vacant lot and ride downtown to the end of the line and walk two blocks to the restaurant.
Name: Book 27

text: Living with my folks is not all that bad, but sharing the bathroom with my sister is.
Name: Book 27

text: They have one bathroom, very small, and Maddy considers it her private territory.
Name: Book 27

text: I have to wade through oceans of makeup and perfume just to brush my teeth.
Name: Book 27

text: Dont ask me about bathing.
Name: Book 27

text: I guess I should tell you about the restaurant.
Name: Book 27

text: Well its called Landers and it is right downtown near whats going on.
Name: Book 27

text: There are theaters and other restaurants nearby and bars and lounges and stores.
Name: Book 27

text: Its in the busiest part of Denver.
Name: Book 27

text: I work the breakfast shift right now, which is alright, but Id rather work lunch because the tips are better.
Name: Book 27

text: Tips arent much good anyway because people dont have money, but I did get a dime yesterday morning from a man.
Name: Book 27

text: I guess I should be grateful.
Name: Book 27

text: A dime is a dime.
Name: Book 27

text: The owner is named Landers Tashitsky.
Name: Book 27

text: I am telling you the truth.
Name: Book 27

text: Hes really a nice old man maybe 55 and he laughed when he told me his name and said that I could see why he didnt name the place with his last name.
Name: Book 27

text: All the people are really nice and I enjoy working there.
Name: Book 27

text: The owner said I could get on lunch real soon because a girl was leaving and hed place me in her spot.
Name: Book 27

text: That will be good because Ill make more money.
Name: Book 27

text: I have to go.
Name: Book 27

text: Its 5 a.
Name: Book 27

text: here and I got to brush my teeth and catch the streetcar.
Name: Book 27

text: I have to be at work at six.
Name: Book 27

text: Please write and let me know how shrimp fishing is.
Name: Book 27

text: My birthday was Sept.
Name: Book 27

text: Next year Ill be 29, too.
Name: Book 27

text: Ha.
Name: Book 27

text: Dont worry about missing my birthday.
Name: Book 27

text: We might have more to come, maybe.
Name: Book 27

text: Shrimp season is over believe it or not.
Name: Book 27

text: I got here late and shrimp season begins in July so I was almost a month late when I got here.
Name: Book 27

text: Fred says there is plenty to do all winter long since its warm down here almost all the time.
Name: Book 27

text: Were going to take his boat out of the water and clean it and paint it and do some repairs on the engine.
Name: Book 27

text: I might enjoy some of that.
Name: Book 27

text: They cant pay me in money but they said Ill eat and have a roof over my head.
Name: Book 27

text: I guess thats all we can ask for in these times.
Name: Book 27

text: Your letter was sad with all the troubles your family is having.
Name: Book 27

text: I wish I could be there to comfort you.
Name: Book 27

text: Is there any possibility of that happening.
Name: Book 27

text: I do not like this place.
Name: Book 27

text: It isnt Fred or Mary because they have been wonderful, but it is so humid down here that I am sure I could scoop up some in a bucket and send it to you.
Name: Book 27

text: The nights are cool but still humid.
Name: Book 27

text: Denver sounds so good.
Name: Book 27

text: Fishing for shrimp isnt fun either.
Name: Book 27

text: I used to like being on a boat when I was in the Navy but they were big ships and didnt rock back and forth ever time you took a step.
Name: Book 27

text: Im always wet and ocean water eats at your skin.
Name: Book 27

text: All I smell is shrimp, mostly dead shrimp and thats not much of a perfume.
Name: Book 27

text: But I understand if it cant be now.
Name: Book 27

text: I respect what you have to do.
Name: Book 27

text: Ive thought a lot about us since Ive been here.
Name: Book 27

text: Maybe more about myself actually.
Name: Book 27

text: I really dont know what I want to do.
Name: Book 27

text: I know I dont want to be a shrimper and I dont want to lay track all my life.
Name: Book 27

text: My toe is doing just fine except I cant feel it.
Name: Book 27

text: Im getting used to that though.
Name: Book 27

text: Working on the railroad was so much fun for me.
Name: Book 27

text: I told you I started when I was a kid right out of the Navy bailing in coal for the L&N.
Name: Book 27

text: To some that would be a bad job but to me it was fun.
Name: Book 27

text: I got to go places and see things and meet people.
Name: Book 27

text: I even liked the noise because it was like being in my own world.
Name: Book 27

text: Engineers used hand signals for what they wanted but most time I could just sit and ride and smoke and think and dream.
Name: Book 27

text: I got to admit that most of my thinking back then was about girls and my life in the service.
Name: Book 27

text: I thought about my family some but they were spread out and we didnt have much contact.
Name: Book 27

text: I would think about you now like I do when Im out on the boat waiting for the nets to fill.
Name: Book 27

text: I think about you lots, kiddo.
Name: Book 27

text: I do love you so much.
Name: Book 27

text: But my hopes and dreams are all mixed up now.
Name: Book 27

text: Eva found a room at the Bonds Hotel around the corner from Landers, about a hundred steps; she counted one day.
